block.p: Gayle Nealy Gruber, the daughter of Diane and Ronald Gruber of Holmdel, N.J., was married on Friday to Thomas Patrick Tizzio, a son of Mary Ann and Thomas Tizzio of Middletown, N.J. The Rev. Anthony Carotenuto performed the ceremony at St. Anthony of Padua Roman Catholic Church in Red Bank, N.J.

Mrs. Tizzio, 30, works at the American Museum of Natural History in Manhattan, where she is the office manager for the department that runs the museum's retail shops. She graduated from Marist College and received a master's degree in retail and art administration from the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her father is the president of Gruber Enterprises, an insurance agency in Red Bank. Her mother is the president of Homeowners Marketing Services, a company in Red Bank that provides home warranties and other real estate services.

Mr. Tizzio, 27, is an underwriter for the National Union Fire Insurance Company, a unit of the American International Group, the insurance and financial services company in Manhattan. His father is the senior vice chairman and a former president of American International and a trustee of the Brooklyn College Foundation and of St. Vincent's Services, a foster care agency in Brooklyn. The bridegroom graduated from Adelphi University.
